abstract: How the common puzzle came to be, and how it came to The New York Times.
snippet: How the common puzzle came to be, and how it came to The New York Times.
lead_paragraph: Among the items that appeared in The New York Sunday World on Dec. 21, 1913: woman in Yonkers is robbed at gunpoint, aviator Glenn Curtiss vows to make the world's first transatlantic flight and phone stocks rise after AT&T relinquishes its holdings of the Western Union Telegraph Company to mollify the Department of Justice. Next to these stories, the lighthearted Fun supplement introduced that day would not seem to be terribly newsworthy. Yet featured in "Fun" was the world's first crossword puzzle, introduced as the "Word-Cross."
